creator: rainer.jung@kippdata.de
text:
The test for largefile support in configure tries to open a file with O_CREAT
without giving a file mode. POSIX says you need to provide a mode if you use
O_CREAT. In fact other places in configure actually do that.

On Solaris if your build directory is on NFS, the open will fail (with or
without LARGEFILE) and thus the LARGEFILE test will fail, although large files
are actualy supported.

As soon as one adds mode bits to the test, it succeeds even when building on an
NFS share.

Created attachment 20467
Patch for configure.in to make largefile support detection more robust
creator: rainer.jung@kippdata.de
rainer.jung@kippdata.de
text:
The patch is against trunk, the same problem and fix also apply for the 1.2.x
branch. Actually I discovered the problem there. I didn't check the older branches.
